chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P McMullen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 380 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Count #16.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution: $24,494.73 - $5,824.21 to Spring Gardens Landscaping & Horticulture; $8,051.52 to Traveler's Insurance; $3,500.00 to Catholic Mutual Group and $6,119.00 to John M.  To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and Prison Earnings.

11/17/2021 TOTAL ON RESTITUITION CORRECTED TO $23,494.73 

 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Surcharges and Cost to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Restitution to be Paid First.

AS OF 6/10/2016: Court amends to eliminate DNA on Count 1 only.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by your Agent, including Sex Offender Treatment.
No possession of any pornographic and/or sexually explicit material.
No possession of any device capable of recording video or photographs without prior Agent approval.
Obtain and Maintain stable residence approved by the Department of Corrections.
Disclose all passwords to Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
No contact with victims, including those in the read in cases, their residences and their schools.

Cases:  #14CF163 and #14CF164 were Dismissed and Read into Case #14CF201.

records.addlTxt:
It is ordered that the no-merit report is rejected, appointed counsel motion to withdraw is denied, and the appeal is dismissed without prejudice.  
It is further ordered that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.302(2)(h), is extended to ninety days from the date of this order.

records.addlTxt:
It is ordered that the no-merit report is rejected, appointed counsel's motion to withdraw is denied, and the appeal is dismissed without prejudice.

It is further ordered that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion  under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30(2)(h), is extended to ninety days from the date of this order.  

It is further ordered that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Michael P McMullen in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Masnica makes statements regarding her corrections in the PSI.

Sentencing argument by Atty. Blasius.

Statement by victim's mother. Statement by defendant's mother and friend. 

Sentencing argument by Atty. Masnica.

Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 1

Imposed Sentence of:

 6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 380 days )  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 16
- 3 Years of Initial Confinement
  3 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- Cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by your agent, including Sex Offender Treatment;
- No possession of any pornographic and/or sexually explicit material;
- No possession of any device capable of recording video or photographs without prior agent approval;
- Obtain and Maintain stable residence approved by the Department of Corrections;
- Disclose all passwords to agent;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge;
- No contact with victims, including those in the read in cases, their residence and their schools.

Restitution: $24,494.73  ($5,824.21 to Spring Gardens  Landscaping & Horticulture, $8,051.52 to Traveler's Insurance, $3,500.00 to Catholic Mutual Group and $6,119.00 to John M.) To be paid during extend supervison and prison earnings.

Image Surcharge:  $8,000.00
Cost: $268.00 
DNA surcharge: $250.00

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

COUNT 16

Imposed Sentence of:

 23 Years Imprisonment 
- 15 Years of Initial Confinement
- 8 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:  SAME AS COUNT 1

Cost: $268.00 
DNA surcharge: $250.00

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Surcharges and costs to be paid during extended supervison.  Restitution to be paid first.
